alert.note: Alert for Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 6:40AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Crenshaw, Escambia, southern Conecuh, Covington, northern Okaloosa, northern Santa Rosa and north central Escambia Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 540 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Elba to 3 miles southwest of I65 And AL 113. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Opp, Brewton, Florala, Century, Flomaton, East Brewton, River Falls, Castleberry, Jay, Red Level, Laurel Hill, Lockhart, Dozier, Heath, Gantt, Pollard, Riverview and I65 And AL 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Inland
